Standard.Name: Calico's Rogues Snare a Merchant Ship 1.1

English.Text: Ask the advice of your former pirate

Standard.Name: Calico's Rogues Snare a Merchant Ship 1.2

English.Text: Fire cannons at the pirates' ship

Standard.Name: Calico's Rogues Snare a Merchant Ship 1.3

English.Text: Try to board the pirates' ship

Standard.Name: Calico's Rogues Snare a Merchant Ship 1.4

English.Text: Make peace, and reason with the officials
Return to the inn in disguise to bait the robbers
Take back what is yours by force
Take the loss on the chin
Get out and push the ship free
Let the rolling berg toss you into the sea.
Build something to help you escape
A steamship should have nothing to fear here
Harpoon them and tug them away
Inspire them to traverse the rope
Send your best swimmers to the rescue
Have an officer make a rousing speech
Stay put and pick them off
Try to break the prisoners out
Send a diver to check it out
Have the doctor investigate what happened
Leave and hope to find an island with drinking water soon
Try to outrun the awful vessel!
Turn and face it, whatever it is!
Build a trap to catch the thing
Sate the demon with a sacrificial offering
Build a trap to catch whatever it is
Have the scientist inspect the gate
Have faith and leap through the flames
Wrap up in something before leaping through
Try to determine how the person died
Answer the mermaid's call with a sailor's chant
Let the fool go if that's what he wants
Convince the sailors to ignore the creature
Drop the issue and let them be
At least let the priest go ahead

Standard.Name: The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.1

English.Text: Believe the old man and follow him

Standard.Name: The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.1.1.1
The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.1.1.1.1.1

English.Text: Read it spiritually, go to the cemetery

Standard.Name: The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.1.1.1.1.2

English.Text: Read it literally and seek out a garden

Standard.Name: The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.1.1.2
The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.1.2.1
The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.1.2.2
The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.1.2.2.1.1
The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.1.2.2.1.2
The Treasure of Hassan Ben Sahid 1.2

English.Text: Study the chalk spirit on the stone
Let your anthropologist piece the clues together
Follow the arrow towards the mountain
Lift the ritual stone back up
Encourage the apostates to have faith
Convince the zealots to be more tolerant
Cry out that you come in peace
Refuse to believe it is real
Refuse to believe she is real
Try again to force the gates
Try to scale the walls instead
Convince the king your crew's affection is genuine
Capture the king a prize animal
Face the verdict of the copper oracle
Await the verdict of the copper oracle
Try to convince the king your crew is worthy
Order the crew to leave at once
Leave without the crew who've fallen in love
Have [AssetData([ExpeditionEventRequirement]) Text] shed light on the meaning of the ritual
Just ask to get some water
Have the first mate convince the devotees to let you through
Stay calm, and offer them a deal instead
Just ask to get some water
Have your men retreat to the ship
Offer the devotees some goods in order to pass
Avoid the temple and find another route to the waterfall
Search for a route to the waterfall source
Give up and return to the ship
Avoid the island altogether and return to the ship
Ask the crew who did this
Side with the priest and prepare a holy fire
Keep guard and capture the perpetrator
Throw them overboard and move on.
Arrange a meeting with the leader of the mutiny
Agree to meet in the sailors' quarters
In a final attempt to keep order, offer a bribe
That's enough disobedience, arrest the chaplain
Make an example of the ringleader
Let a woman do the talking
Respond to their violence in kind
Let them board ship and take the man
They'll have to fight you for him
Offer to pay the fugitive's bail
Use hunting knowledge to get the better of the bears
Hide in the cave and pray
Attack the bear blocking the way
Track the wounded bear with him
Fire a torpedo at the thing
Divine the meaning of the glyph stone
Refuse to believe in a city of gold
Look for a ford to cross on foot
Wait on the town's balconies, ready for an ambush
Wait at the saloon, ready for a fight
Avoid trouble and simply give up
Create a raft to cross the river
Enlist the aid of the hypnotist
Examine the cause of this wildness in him
Try to calm the crew, and pray the man recovers
Side with the officers and warn the sailors to cooperate or suffer the consequences
Convince the officers the needs of the many must prevail over the needs of the few
Guard him round the clock in his cabin
Ignore the officers and get rid of him before it's too late
Examine the cabins for some sort of parasite
Have the afflicted bathe in holy water
Find somewhere to stop and be rid of it
Lie that the sickness isn't contagious
Threaten them into letting you go
Let them itch, it's common at sea
Cover the leg with a mix of water and soap and pull it away
Cut the leg with a bone saw
Lift the mast with a makeshift lever
Examine the entrails of the shark for clues
Navigate closer to the islands and their reefs
Stay away and have the look-out search for castaways
Interpret the patterns in the shark's entrails
Map the islands matching the partial coordinates
There's no time to spare for such things
Demonstrate that his doubts are fuelled by a mental illness
Discredit him in a direct confrontation
Simply punish him without taking measures against his ideas
Disguise as guards and escort the rest of the crew
Offer to pay a fine, however high it might be
Plead they were following orders and have the crew repudiate Her Majesty
Avoid drawing any attention and sneak outside
Offer to pay a fine instead
Force your crew into complying with the unreasonable demand
Bombard the frigate as you leave
Prepare your defence for the upcoming trial
Build a snow anchor to descend into the crevasse
Bind their broken limbs with splints and help them climb
Bind the wounded to the safety rope and pull them up
Send scouts in the night to find help
Camp and hunt for food while waiting for rescue
Look for another way into the crevasse
Carry the wounded up the slope
Talk them into a calmer behaviour
Have the weakened sailors try to pull the others up
Put the wounded out of their misery before leaving
Inspect the man at the risk of contamination
This was the delirium of a dying man
This was the accusation of a victim
Observe the evolution of the lunatic's symptoms
Find evidence on the dead man's body
Find evidence in the dead man's belongings
Confine the madman in the hold
Part with a large portion of your supplies
Hunt the floe for fresh meat
Promise to call in help and leave
Invite as many as you can onboard
Break the floe with your cannons
They can take care of themselves, leave
Set sail and try to outrun them
Allow him to inspect the ship
Talk him out of the inspection
Send your strongest fighter for a brawl
Send your best shot for a pistol duel
Send your brightest officer for a trial of wits
They want to fight? Let them come!
Offer them a drink to ease the tension
Show them the drinking ability of seafarers
Drug their drinks to avoid the confrontation
If it's a fight they want, they'll get one
This is a waste of time, simply apologize
Climb the mast and detach the frozen sails
Aim at the ties holding the rogue sail
Fire all guns and shake off the ice
Strengthen the mast with chains and planks
Boil seawater to gather ice-melting salt
Stay inside and hope the supplies last
Use dynamite to start a chain reaction
Try to weave through the minefield
Go through diplomatic papers in search of any clues
Turn around and try to escape
Tell them to stay on the ship
Use a reflective object to signal help
Ask at the fort for help
Ignore the fort and continue along the path
Wait for a sign of the true path
Avoid the whirlpool and maneuver to dodge the shore
Spin the ship to take the damage on its flank
Bombard the shore in an attempt to slow the ship
Avoid the shore and hope the whirlpool won't suck the ship in
Go back to the ship despite the darkness
Find shelter against the incoming lava
Pray for the chapel to hold
Dig trenches in the holy ground
Follow a random animal and trust its instincts
Pick a random path and trust your instincts
Board the bandits' steamer with your gunboat
Shadow the kidnappers back to their hideout with a river skiff
Attack the bandits before they reach the barn
Go all out on the bandits and save the remaining children
Acknowledge the danger and leave with what children are already saved
Hide between the tree and wait for nightfall
Steal their clothes to disguise as bandits
Capture the men to use them as hostages
Bluff and pretend backup is on its way
The children are safe with you, punish their abductors
The children will be safer with their parents, let the kidnappers leave
Stay on your ship and deploy fire when the steamboat appears
Scare the kidnappers into revealing the position of their hideout
Enough risks for today: return the children and be on your way
Shadow the kidnappers back to their hideout with a river skiff
Ignore the bandits and go on your way
Follow the suggested route and progress through the traps
Find a way among the snakes
Scare the snakes away with torches
Look for a possible hidden mechanism
Create your own path and push the boulder away
Push against the wall to stop it
Pray that the usual method will work and reef the sails
Wait for the storm to pass
Order the crew to finish reefing the sails
Maneuver with what sails you have left
Frenzied measures for frenzied times: open all sails and ride the storm
Time the anchor's release to counterbalance the ship
Fill the bottom of the hold to keep it steady
Use the steam engines to carefully follow the trough of waves
Overheat the engines to outrun the storm
Maintain a steady pace and let the storm push you off-tracks
Fasten the ballast back into place
Make use of the steamships sails to survive
Overwork the steam engines to boldly escape the storm
Attempt to use the remaining engine without your engineer
Forget engineering, and hope the Lord will protect the volunteer
Insist on using your crafting wits, and protect him yourself
Shut off the engines and rely on your sails
Traverse the mountain on your own
Go forward, leaving marks for the lost sailors to follow
Follow a stream of melted snow running downhill
Force your way through the mounds of powder snow
Prioritise your supplies and look for food
Go back, and look for the missing sailors
Pull the sailors from the fault, at the risk of falling
Release the stern anchor to the sea floor
Take the time to present this solution as the best
Repair the hole while the water is still pouring
Move the ballast to lift the hole above sea level
Drug them to avoid losing any more time
Improvise a sea anchor on the surface of the water
Throw the oil cargo overboard to calm the seas
Launch the steam ship at full speed.
Maneuver the ship to avoid the whales.
Throw a roped harpoon to save the drowning sailors.
Get away from the flustered whales.
Sing a military favorite to scare the whales away.
Send a man in the diving bell to fix the rudder.
Fire canons in the water to scare the whales away.
Wait for the whales to leave
Keep sailing straight ahead, at the risk of collision.
Use your gunboat to navigate the shallows
Have the ship transported over the hill to rejoin the river further up
Proceed uphill without materials, belief will guide us through
Ask the locals gathered around the scene if they are able to help
Attempt to carefully navigate the narrow passage
Decline to proceed any further and return to sea
Craft something to traverse the terrain
Urge your party to face their fears
Craft longer ropes and swing down
Fashion a device to extract water from mud
Look for the source of the river
Immediately run away and leave the area entirely
Wait for nightfall, hoping they leave
Send your diver into the depths
Hope that it will resist the dive and push the bell into the hole
Ignore the pearl and risk the dive into darkness
Retrieve the pearl from the dead-end and resurface
Pick up the coin and resurface
Use the electric water pump to allow proper repairs
Improvise a water pump to allow immediate repairs
Throw supplies overboard to try and bring the crack over the waterline
Seal the overflowing section, regardless of what or who might still be inside
Seal the damaged section and repair it at the next harbour

Standard.Name: The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.1

English.Text: The Expert will have the answers

Standard.Name: The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.2
The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.2.1.1

English.Text: Conduct an autopsy of the body

Standard.Name: The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.2.1.1.2.1
The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.2.1.1.2.2
The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.2.1.2

English.Text: Fashion a tool for gathering forensic evidence

Standard.Name: The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.2.1.2.2.1
The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.2.1.2.2.2

English.Text: Put the fear of god into the suspects

Standard.Name: The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.2.1.2.2.3

English.Text: Dump all the suspects at the next port, and be done with it

Standard.Name: The Singular Case of the Midshipman 1.3

English.Text: Do nothing, it's suicide - nothing more to be said
Tell him to check his calculations again
Make them stop. Everyone makes mistakes.
Let them continue, for light relief
What in the world is happening to him!?
The ship's clergyman should see him
Confine him to his bunk and maintain the current course
Tell the crew not to lose faith!

Standard.Name: All Good Things Come From Above 1.1

English.Text: Let [AssetData([ExpeditionEventRequirement]) Text] go ashore to investigate

Standard.Name: All Good Things Come From Above 1.1.1.1

English.Text: Let's take them home. Catch some!

Standard.Name: All Good Things Come From Above 1.1.1.2

English.Text: Leave them be and enjoy their beauty

Standard.Name: All Good Things Come From Above 1.2

English.Text: Send the first mate ashore, give him a chance for revenge!

Standard.Name: All Good Things Come From Above 1.2.1.1
All Good Things Come From Above 1.2.1.2

English.Text: That's enough. We should leave them be

Standard.Name: All Good Things Come From Above 1.3

English.Text: Wait a little longer. Lets hope they're still alive
We cannot wait any longer. They are lost and so will be the rest of the expedition if we don't continue
Dress as La Corona officers and bluff your way in
Try to bribe an La Corona soldier
Take the most direct land route to Isabel
Wait for your moment to disarm them
Convince them of your good intentions
Build a raft and take the quicker river route
Disembark and follow the map instead
Reinforce the raft and keep paddling
Maintain your fire on the weakened engine
Aim to disable the dread cannon
Aim some grenados toward the enemy deck
Take this chance to flee the bay
Aim to disable the dread cannon
Send a team to sabotage the fiery cannon
Aim at the engine to immoblise the Dragon.
Try and outrun them while they rearm
Take advantage of the darkness and try to sneak by
Escape the bay before they can catch you
Aim to disable the dread cannon
Trick the Pyrophorians into following you through the shallows
Fill the sails and power up the rapids
Find a way through the caves
Disembark and search for Isabel on foot
Repair the ship and continue downriver
Fire at the cliff between you and the Pyrphorians
Co-ordinate your way down and back up
"We are here on behalf of Her Majesty the Queen!"
"My father was Samuel Goode. I am here to stop the Pyrphorians!"
"My father was Samuel Goode. I am here to take Prosperity back!"
"Even if it was my father, the Pyrphorians must have forced him to sell!"
"Admit it, you conspired with the Pyrphorians to buy it!"
"Can't you see, the Pyrphorians are evil!"
"I am the child of Samuel Goode."
Let them run, and instead try to establish their likely destination
Swing over to their ship and get among them
Continue to target the mast and rigging
Train your main guns on their cannons
Check every nearby harbour in the hope of finding them
Entreat the local authorities for information
Trust your lookouts to keep you in range
Take a shortcut via the inlet
Maintain course, following them around the island
Study the map to guess their most likely docking point
Entreat nearby local authorities for information
Ask the local Montoyans if they know anything
A little recompense always calms the nerves
Smash down the warehouse door and charge in
Find some way to sneak inside
Fan through the city, looking for clues.
Go to the church and ask the Priest for help
Go to the den of ill-repute and ask the Madam for help
Spend some time in the establishment
Play it bold, launching an assault on the house
Draw the enemy out, so you can flank them
Get behind the senior officer and charge!
Play it sneaky, have your best person go in alone
Knock through the glass with a sword hilt to turn the handle
Fashion something with which to pick the lock
Knock through the glass with a sword hilt to turn the handle
Climb the nearest tree and wait for an opening
Play it crafty, send someone in dressed as one of the congregation
Talk their way out of it
